result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Antonitsas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to the Department of Corrections by 3:00 PM, Friday June 13, 2014.  Probation agent may recommend early discharge.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.   Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must comply with all of the CHIPS Order.

timeConds.notes: 3 days jail credit if probation is revoked.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric J Antonitsas in court with attorney Ryan J Raymond.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense relates agreement: 
Amend count 1 to 961.41(3g)(d) a Misdemeanor. Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 1. Court grants amendment and accepts plea. 
DRI counts 2,3, and 4. Court grants. 

Defense makes argument. Defendant addresses the Court. 
Court relates and orders: 

SW 
1 year probation. Must report to the Department of Corrections by 3:00 PM, Friday June 13, 2014.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must comply with all of the CHIPS Order. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Probation agent may recommend early discharge. 
3 days jail credit if revoked. 
Court Costs.

Defendant Eric J Antonitsas in court with attorney Ryan J Raymond.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Eric J Antonitsas in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:12  Court calls the case;
4:13  Officer Jon Fick with the Chetek Police Dept called, sworn, direct by state;    Witness identified the defendant;  
4:17  cross by Attorney Raymond
  Probable Cause Found and Bound Over
  Information Filed.

  Arraignment scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191. 

 Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must not possess any firearms

Defendant Eric J Antonitsas in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant Eric J Antonitsas in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 04:15 pm.
